utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How are you doing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not so well I I feel like I've been having just worsening breathlessness and a cough for it's been going on for two years now and I just can't seem to get rid of it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, the cough and breathlessness both started two years ago?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I would say approximately around the same time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Um, do you always have the breathlessness, or does it come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I think it's, I feel short of breath most of the times, but it's mainly just gets worse when I'm exerting myself when I'm walking more than usual or just working in the garden.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, um and same thing with the cough? It gets worse when you're walking around?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I would say so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And was there any sort of trigger for this two years ago? Anything that you remember?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, it kind of just started gradually on its own. No, no real triggers that I can remember.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and, does anything make it worse or better besides the exertion?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I think that's pretty much the only thing that really makes it worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how would you describe your breathlessness? Is it that you're breathing too fast or you can't catch your breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's I think it's more so just I can't catch my breath and sometimes I just have trouble being able to take like a full breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Um, and out of 1 to 10, 10 being the worst, how bad is your breathlessness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It can get up to I would say like an eight sometimes when I'm doing a lot of work.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you ever experienced this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not before the two years, before I I never felt anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you mentioned it's gradually been getting worse, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I would say so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and the cough, um, do you ever cough up any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's uh, it's usually just a dry cough. No, no I don't produce any mucus or blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK. Um, and do you feel like you're wheezy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't heard any kind of wheeziness at all.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any issues with your breathlessness when you're laying down?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I'm completely fine laying down.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and it's not waking you up at night, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um, have there been any changes to your taste recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes to your smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you experienced a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Runny nose or stuffy nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope, not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, changes in your hearing or ear pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Changes in your vision or eye pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you noticed any fevers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, maybe some chills here and there, but not not really a fever, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you mentioned chills. How about night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, just a few times per week I would maybe have to take off my blanket sometimes I notice a lot of my sweat covering the bed sheets. That's been going on for about, say a couple months now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK um any weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think over the last few months I may have lost like around 3 three kilograms.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, any rashes on your body?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not that I know, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um, how about uh like feeling you're like you're tired?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, yeah, I feel pretty tired sometimes, but I just thought it was because I'm getting older.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, fair enough. How about chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No chest pain, no no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any swelling in your arms or legs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I've noticed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and how about feeling like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No heart has been fine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how about changes to your bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I go pretty regularly.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and urine, any changes there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about nausea and vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um any dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? Ok, um how about confusion or memory loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not that I know of, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you otherwise healthy? Do you have any other medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do have high blood pressure and I think they said like my prostate is larger than normal. Um, but nothing else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been sick in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, in terms of like breathing, I think maybe as a child like I may have had like a pneumonia but nothing else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you on any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just ramipril for my high blood pressure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um how long have you been on that medication for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, for a pretty long time, I would say more than 10 years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and no issues, side effects with that, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, and my blood pressure is pretty well controlled on that medication.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, good, um, any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. No allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Are you up to date with all of your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah I got my shingles and my pneumonia vaccination everything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh, in terms of family history, um, are there any heart or lung conditions that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, so yeah, my dad had quite a few problems. He had type 2 diabetes then he suffered from 2 strokes and then he also had a heart attack uh, in I think when he was like 56. But then he actually ended up dying of bowel cancer in his 70s.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How about your mother? Is she alive? Is she healthy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, my mom is alive, but she suffered from Type 2 diabetes and high blood pressure as well. And she also had, like hypothyroidism. And she also suffered from depression as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um OK, so do you live by yourself and where do you live?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live on an apartment and in apartment by myself right now. I do find it difficult getting out of the house recently just because of my shortness of breath, but other than that I feel that I'm pretty independent.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've never smoked in my life.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? Um, how about other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no marijuana, no cocaine, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about alcohol? Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you still work?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I actually worked at just the hospital I used to volunteer, but now I just can't get out of the house. I feel just tired and short of breath all the time so just staying in my house most of the time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and has anyone around you been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No um, and have you traveled anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, have you been worked up for this in the past two years? Like have you had any chest X-rays or pulmonary function tests or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've never really had this issue before, so no investigations.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, well those were all the questions that I had. Did you have anything that you wanted to add that I maybe missed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I just it's been going on for two years and I feel like it's getting worse and worse. And yeah, I'm just scared of having to, you know, go on oxygen or like just not being able to breathe at one point.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. So we will try to do a good job working you up for everything that we think it may be. And right now, it sounds like it could be pulmonary fibrosis either like you know an autoimmune process or triggered after like an infection that you may have had in the past. We will definitely also look into see if it's perhaps a lung cancer, asthma and you mentioned you don't smoke so we don't think it could be COPD but we'll also test for that in case all everything else comes back negative.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, sounds good. Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
